Reviews.Title: Now I understand the price drop!
Reviews.Author: Bob from Mass.
Reviews.Content: This is a real nice camera for the price, but the wifi, which is the reason I got it, was kind of a pain to set up. There is a button for a wifi "wizard," which should make things easier, but it didn't. That's because, at least for the average buyer, there's not enough information in the box to guide you through some of the things you need to know or have questions on. (I think most users are like me; you set up a wifi connection with a device, pray that it works, and then, thorugh trial and error, you're not even sure what you did that got you to the end result! And then you forget all that until you need to do it again.) I tried on line help at Panasonic and emailed their customer service, and got no where. Finally, I called their 800 number. Talked to a nice techie, but I think he was figuring it out on the fly, just as I was.Here are two (I think) big helps for others who run into similar problems: 1. You CAN'T use the wifi until after you load the software and set up a folder where the wifi will transfer your pictures to. (Embedded in the directions, it does tell you to do that first, but it's far from apparent that things just won't work until then!) Second, once you load the software, you actually get a window that tells you exactly what you need to input in the final stage of wifi set up (but the nomenclature is slightly different, and that helpful fact was never made clear!), and this is where my problem occurred. BEWARE: if you have a computer that doesn't have a password, the final step WILL NOT WORK! (I never bothered with a password on my laptop:one extra step, and I've never worried about it: you need a password.) Apparently, the code is written so you HAVE TO input a password; you can't just leave it blank (At least their software program listed my password as "NONE," and that's what gave me the idea to try again once I added a password. The Panasonic techie had no clue as he walked me through exactly what I had done in the wifi set up (again), and he should have known about this issue since in my original email, I asked if that was the problem.I can imagine all kinds of people returning this camera over frustration with the wifi (I mean, why would you keep it if you can't make this higher end feature doesn't work? Too bad, because I think I'm really going to like the camera itself. What I've seen so far, the menu choices are much easier to deal with that my older digital, an Olympus Zoom. I would strongly suggest to Panasonic that they put better "Quick Start" instructions in the box, ones that are consumer tested by ordinary people who are a little unsure of terminology and need the hand-holding. It's actually a 4 or 5 star camera with 2 star directions.

Reviews.Title: Good camera with awesome WiFi.
Reviews.Author: alan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace an IP video camera, in order to be able to watch for expected visitors without being tied to the front window, allowing me to get other things done while waiting.  It works very well for that purpose.  In fact it is considerably better than the IP video camera purpose-built for that. This camera is particularly good for that that because it is small and unobtrusive, it can auto-focus and auto-adjust for the light conditions, and be remotely zoomed if desired.  Because it is battery-powered, I didn't expect it to have much WiFi range, and it doesn't, but it is good enough be to useful for me.  Working by remote control from my Android phone or tablet, the battery lasts for a couple hours. For more time, I also purchased a DMW-DCC10/DMW-AC5 AC adapter, which works well.The camera also takes good still pictures, and because of its small, easily pocketable size, it has been very useful to take along when I go out just in case an unexpected photo opportunity arises.  The SZ5 doesn't have a mode dial or touch screen, but none-the-less, is quite useable.For improvements, I'd like to see the WiFi remote control range increased.  Perhaps that could be done by also allowing a remote control mode that works through an existing WiFi channel.The WiFi remote control experiment Panasonic tried with this camera is very successful.  I think they have done a good job of it, and I find it very useful. I wish my FZ150 and GH2 had it as well, and suspect it'll be a highly prized feature on the GH3.  I'm glad I purchased this camera.

Reviews.Title: What a fun/practical camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Mussmann "Coffeeguy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this my camera for my wife because she mentioned that it would be nice to have a camera that the pictures would automatically be transferred to our computer or phones so they didn't just reside in the camera until we erase them to make room for more pictures. It is a little tricky, the first couple of times, to connect the wifi. It is so easy now, that we set the camera up and surprise people by taking their picture remotely and transfer the pictures, to our external hard drive, automatically, every time we plug in to charge.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: joseph hamvas
Reviews.Content: this is my third Panasonic camera,  love all of them. this one is TRUE point and shoot. all pictures, no matter the light situation, come out perfect. indoors or out. you get a lot for your money.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-SZ5 great compact camera
Reviews.Author: Bruce Wolf
Reviews.Content: The camera is just what I wanted. It is small and very easy to use. I purchased for a friend, who also loves it. The only drawback is that there is apparently no fill flash setting. This is a bit upsetting. However, when using the customized SCN settings, there is a setting which I think would substitute.

Reviews.Title: wifi
Reviews.Author: jacob
Reviews.Content: great camera, the wifi was an important feature and it works awesome.  love being able to snap shots from afar with my smartphone.  im not that into specs but this thing shoots photos well enough for me and mine.  would reccommend.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Sebylita "Sebylita"
Reviews.Content: Compact camera. Great pictures. Wi-Fi function easy to setup. Awesome new way of taking pictures and sending them online. Love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: FastPT "pT"
Reviews.Content: Have been working with it for a short while. But have a lot of problems with WiFi connection when on the Mac OS

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: James D Pettigrew, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Purchased for college age daughter who needed a new compact camera to go with her more advanced digital SLR's, etc.  Love the quality of photos and the wifi capability that allows her to control the camera from her IPhone for self portraits, etc.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: SJHum
Reviews.Content: Quality pictures. Lots of options and user friendly. Competitive price. Convenient size with large LCD monitor. Would highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: not very user friendly
Reviews.Author: Mitchell Wright
Reviews.Content: awful plastic feel, wifi is very complicated to set up. would not recommend this product. I purchased this for my mom for christmas as a way to easily upload her photos. It took hours for me to figure out how to set up wifi and iphone compatibility, never completely figured it out and mom said to return it as it was too complicated for her.

Reviews.Title: Lumix sz5
Reviews.Author: ANTON HARMAN
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera,  about the size of a deck of cards,  so portable.  Excellent stills great zoom able video. Just purchased another sz5 for my bosses wife she like mine so much.  Been using Lumix cameras for 10 years this is typically a great product from Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, great picture quality
Reviews.Author: N. Singh
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera few hours back and loving its picture quality. It has excellent zoom, I took some snapshots of sky and indoors and came out fantastic. Setting up wifi was a breeze, very easy.

Reviews.Title: Gee-whiz features, so-so pictures
Reviews.Author: D. Williams
Reviews.Content: I do like the wi-fi features and powerful zoom, but the pictures aren't great. Low-light performance is pretty bad and the colors aren't terribly rich. For the money, it's a good purchase. For another $30-40, you can get a much better camera.

Reviews.Title: Graduation Gift
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: I ordered this gift at the last minute as an addition to my daughter's graduation gifts and I am so very happy with the purchase and timely delivery. She took it on a trip to Greece and absolutely loved the quality of the pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: auslender gilles
Reviews.Content: Great lens for the price. Very easy and  convenient remote controls in wifi with or without an existing wifi network around, with the Lumix Link IPad or Android App. I tried both and got the control of the camera in 20 seconds.

Reviews.Title: Nice enough camera.
Reviews.Author: Tim Peters
Reviews.Content: It's a decent camera. The pictures are of decent quality. The first one we received had dust on the sensor which showed in every picture. The second one has been fine so far.The wifi portion of the camera couldn't be more difficult to use if they tried. As such, we never bother. I tried to get it working on vacation so we could post some of the pictures for family but decided my time was better spent having fun.

Reviews.Title: Pretty cool little camera
Reviews.Author: DWheels
Reviews.Content: I wanted something that would easily fit in my pocket, take excellent quality pics, and be inexpensive.  I got all that and more.  I'm amazed at how much cameras have improved in the last decade (that's how long I had my last one). The only down side is I should be careful what I ask for; it's so small and thin I have difficulty holding on to it with my arthritic hands.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at $150.
Reviews.Author: CG
Reviews.Content: When considering the main point of a camera is to take photos, I'd say this camera takes very good P&S-quality; photos.It'd be 5 stars if the WiFi support was better. My beefs: Slow transfer. Limited number of services to transfer to. Doesn't support spaces in usernames for SMB transfers. No open transfer option for a create-your-own web service. Other little annoying problems that I have to work around.I think this is Panasonic's first attempt at a WiFi camera. I hope there is a firmware update coming soon that would address these issues.

Reviews.Title: Got this for $100 at Christmas
Reviews.Author: @Mead57 "mediomonti"
Reviews.Content: This is a tremendous camera with lots of cool features. Most importantly it takes good pictures. The zoom is special.

Reviews.Title: DMC-SZ5W Panasonic camera
Reviews.Author: David a/v fan
Reviews.Content: The ability to upload and send pics wirelessly was very attractive, but in reality, it doesn't work.  I could not get either to work. The instructions are pathetic, and I haven't yet summoned up the courage to spend hours on the phone with a tech guy (plus I have zero confidence he or she will solve the problem).  On the plus side, it takes outstanding pictures and has a nice long zoom; that alone is worth the $100 I paid, and it's the reason I gave it any stars.  But don't buy it for its wireless capabilities; they suckk.Hopefully this is Panasonic's wifi 1.01, and in five years or so, they'll have perfected it.

Reviews.Title: Lasted 35 days
Reviews.Author: JEC
Reviews.Content: This camera is no longer made by Panasonic. The shutter would no longer open after about 35 days of ownership. Had to jump through hoops, but finally got this replaced under warranty with a newer model.

Reviews.Title: WiFi does NOT WORK for iphone
Reviews.Author: Mom in NJ
Reviews.Content: The 1800 number was of no help. I could successfully set up the app to use WiFi for the Samsung Galaxy (so I DO know how to correctly get this to work on a phone), but when using the same app for iPhone, it simply will not work - it gets "hung up" on the Login screen.  When you call the 800 number about Lumix Link, the app that is supposed to upload photos via your phone, the techs have NO KNOWLEDGE of Lumix Link, even though Lumix Link is repeatedly referenced in the guide provided with the camera.In summary, there is a bug with the wifi app for iphone, and their tech support sucks so much that they don't even know about it. So frustrated. Will never buy a Panasonic product after this again due to the lack of technical support.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: brianshale
Reviews.Content: This is a great compact camera.  It fits easily in my hip pocket and can zoom in for close-ups and take action stills far better than my smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Susan E
Reviews.Content: I have a not quite 2 yr old Lumix DMC-SZ5 with a Panasonic lens. I loved it UNTIL I developed spots on my photos, which apparently are from dust inside . Researching, I found Panasonic seems to have a problem with this but they will do nothing for me. I can have it cleaned here for $75-$100 but I think I'll just get a new camera. Maybe go back to Canon. If I get it cleaned they tell me I would need to wipe it every time I zoom in/out or it'll happen again. Ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product!
Reviews.Author: Antonio Contreras
Reviews.Content: already had a panasonic camera, but I wanted to get something smaller, comfortable, good quality, both in image and versatility, this product meets these requirements

Reviews.Title: Awful software
Reviews.Author: Donald L. Peterson "dlp"
Reviews.Content: The only reason this review has one star is because Amazon does not allow no stars!! The camera as a camera, taking pictures and video is awesome, however Panasonic should be ashamed to have included such perfectly awful software. The software appears to have been written by a brain dead high school computer science student. The software will NOT run on Windows 7 64bit Ultimate, PHOTOfunStudio 8.4 SE is definitely NOT fun!!! This is totally inexcusable from a company of Panasonic's reputation. The WiFi is difficult to setup, when it should be totally obvious! When finally setup the WiFi does work. The total package is what Steve Jobs would have labeled as total crap!!! Apple would have never shipped such useless software for operating and communicating with the devices on the device list. By the way, I did READ the manual and install instruction completely!!Edited: The ZoomBrowser EX by Canon works perfectly with the DMC-SZ5! If Canon can do it, what's wrong with Panasonic?

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: rene ignacio
Reviews.Content: So far it has fulfilled my expectations, the panorama shot, night scene, and taking backlit photos works. The controls are easy to follow. it is small, but capable , very good price and the I received it on time.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Zachary Canizales
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything and more than I had intended it for. The pictures are clear and crisp. Thanks Amazon

Reviews.Title: Lots of features
Reviews.Author: Jewel
Reviews.Content: I just need to take the time to learn them.  Overall, it's a nice point and shot camera.  I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: BAD Wi-Fi
Reviews.Author: cylu
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is definitely good enough for my use.The worse is the Wi-Fi. My set up process was actually pretty smooth, unlike other reviewers. But whenever I connect the camera to my phone or my computer, after a few minutes the camera always completely freezes. I cannot even turn it off. I had to take out the battery... This is not what I expected at all. Better off buying the SZ1.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic software ruined my customer experience
Reviews.Author: used to be
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product from NewEgg (better price) but want to review it on Amazon as well. The specs are great and this may be a great product, but I have lost an entire month and all of my pictures because of the PHOTOfunSTUDIO software that comes with the camera. The CD that comes with the camera asks you to load one of two software programs. One is a free 30 day trial and then there is a charge. I loaded the other software (PHOTOfunSTUDIO 8.4). I found this software totally non-intuitive. It brings up all the photos on your hard drive but does not show what directory or sub directory they are in. I could not figure out how to view the photos I took on the camera. I thought I was deleting the sample pics I had taken on the camera and instead deleted all the photos on my computer hard drive. I got so disgusted with the software I did not touch the camera for a month. When I picked it up today, I decided to print the PHTOTOfunSTUDIO manual (184 pages) to try to learn about the software. It is incomprehensible. I could not even determine what type of digital file I was creating when I took a pic. Was I creating a .JPEG or .TIFF file or some sort of proprietory Panasonic file? I called the 800 number and asked some pointed questions. I learned that I did not even have to use the PHOTOfunSTUDIO software, that I could use the image viewing Microsoft software that came with my computer. So, I deleted the PHOTOfunSTUDIO software from my programs and threw out the 184 page color manual that I just printed out. I have now found an Owner's Manual on the same CD (also 184 pages), and have printed that out. I am still short all of the photos that I lost on my hard drive. I know what the game is now. Panasonic is trying to tie you into their proprietary software so the next time you need a camera, you will be less likely to buy a Sony or Canon. Unfortunately, this business strategy by Panasonic does not benefit the consumer, just the opposite, it takes away from their fine products by confusing the consumer and wasting his time (and in my case, deleting his irreplacable photos). 1 out of 5 stars guys. Fire your software engineers and your marketing genius's and put on the 1st page of the Basic Owner's Manual (which is a seperate document from the 184 page Owner's Manual) this statement: ATTENTION BUYERS: IT IS NOT NECESSARY TO USE PANASONIC SOFTWARE TO USE THIS PRODUCT. IN FACT, USING PANASONIC SOFTWARE WILL BE DETRIMENTAL TO YOUR CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE. THIS CAMERA CREATES .JPEG FILES THAT CAN BE VIEWED, COPIED, PASTED, AND DELETED USING THE MICROSOFT SOFTWARE THAT COMES WITH YOUR COMPUTER. HAVE A NICE DAY!1/22/13 update: In the 184 page manual that I printed out, there are no instructions on how to load the photos onto a personal computer. I had to figure that out myself without any help from the 184 page manual. I drop my rating from 1 star to 1/2 star.

Reviews.Title: Takes pretty good pictures
Reviews.Author: John Shaw
Reviews.Content: It's a nice small pocket camera which is what I was looking for. Takes pretty good pictures. As for some people's complaints that it doesn't have any filter features, that doesn't matter to me. I've got really good editing software on my computer. One of the main reasons I bought this was the built in wi-if. I will agree with some people that it was a pain to connect. I've hooked up wi-if in my house & friends houses. getting this to work with my phones wi-if hotspot was a real pain. I got it working but that's the reason for only 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-SZ%K
Reviews.Author: J. Rutledge
Reviews.Content: Pleased with purchase and seller; quick shipment and no problems on this end. Item is new with registration and warranty and as described.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but the wifi....
Reviews.Author: CyberBug "Sandy"
Reviews.Content: Is really bad, I ended up sending the camera back,  because sometimes it connects and sometimes it dosent, I wanted to use it with my ipad, it works ok, but just getting it to connect is a hassle.

Reviews.Title: La camara Lumix
Reviews.Author: zulay ruiz
Reviews.Content: La camara me ha gustado mucho, toma fotografias con gran nitidez, inclusive aquellas donde las personas estan en movimiento tiene una aplicacion que permite captar las imagenes sin que queden movidas.. Es muy buena

ProductInfo.Features:
14.1 megapixel
Powerful 10x z OIS zoom
Auto Picture transfer to PC/Cloud while Charging the Camera
MP4 Movie Recording
3.0-inch Intelligent LCD that automatically adjusts the backlight based on the environment's lighting
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-SZ5W 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom & WiFi - White
